---
title: GitHub Pull Request Demo
---

# GitHub Pull Request

This runbook demonstrates the GitHubPullRequest block, which provides a streamlined way to create pull requests from within a runbook.

## Step 1: Authenticate to GitHub

<GitHubAuth
  id="gh-auth"
  title="Connect to GitHub"
  description="Authenticate to access repositories and create pull requests"
/>

## Step 2: Clone a Repository

<GitClone
  id="clone-repo"
  gitHubAuthId="gh-auth"
  title="Clone a Repository"
  description="Clone the repository you want to create a PR for"
  prefilledUrl="https://github.com/gruntwork-io/runbooks-test"
  prefilledRepoPath="."
  prefilledLocalPath="./runbooks-test"
/>

## Step 3: Make Some Changes

<Command
  id="make-changes"
  title="Update configuration"
  description="Append a timestamp entry to the changelog"
  command="date '+- Updated via runbook on %Y-%m-%d at %H:%M:%S' >> $REPO_FILES/CHANGELOG.md"
/>

## Step 4: Create a Pull Request

<GitHubPullRequest
  id="create-pr"
  githubAuthId="gh-auth"
  title="Open Pull Request"
  description="Create a pull request with the changes from this runbook"
  prefilledPullRequestTitle="Update changelog via runbook"
  prefilledPullRequestDescription={"## Changes\n\n- Added a new changelog entry with timestamp\n- Generated automatically by the GitHub Pull Request demo runbook"}
  prefilledPullRequestLabels={["documentation"]}
/>
